channel.title: Influxdb on Goldydocs
channel.description: Recent content in Influxdb on Goldydocs

item.title: How-to-get-started
item.description: Run docker run -d -p 8086:8086 \ -e DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE=setup \ -e DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_USERNAME=my-user \ -e DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_PASSWORD=my-password \ -e DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ORG=my-org \ -e DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_BUCKET=my-bucket \ -e DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ADMIN_TOKEN=my-super-secret-auth-token \ --restart=always \ --name influxdb275 \ influxdb:2.7.5

item.title: Vew-data-in-vs-code
item.description: Download and install the Flux extension. Add influxdb connection by clicking the button: Take LNG for example, Try the demo flux query: from(bucket: "my-bucket") |> range(start: 0) |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "config-data") |> sort(desc: true, columns: ["_time"]) |> limit(n: 1) Click “Run -> Run without debugging”: One should get data like:
